facts: The Great Wall of China was built over many centuries by different dynasties to help defend against invasions and control borders.
Ancient Egyptians built pyramids as tombs for pharaohs, and the Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the oldest and largest still standing.
The Silk Road was a network of trade routes that connected Asia, the Middle East, and Europe, spreading goods and ideas like paper and religions.
In ancient Athens, some citizens practiced direct democracy by voting on laws themselves, but many people like women and enslaved people could not vote.
The Roman Empire built long roads and aqueducts to move armies, trade goods, and supply cities with fresh water.
The printing press, improved by Johannes Gutenberg in the 1400s, helped books spread faster and made information easier for many people to access.
World War II ended in 1945, and soon after many countries helped create the United Nations to work toward peace and cooperation.
